pros: Good compensation, strong corporate culture, good team. The company suffered some major setbacks but it still may surprise the competition especially in case funds are available - which is possible if MS is serious about entering the smart device market.
cons: After its principal business was purchased by Microsoft it's hard to tell what's going to happen next including the prospects of the employees. That may help unless MS would handle it the same way as Google did with Motorola.

review_title: One of the most beatiful and interesting company to develop your career
pros: Nordic Corporate Culture, one of the best in the world. It was a big pleasure has worked along with very smart and hardworking people. This company loves listening and demands innovation for everybody.
cons: A slow mammoth and sometimes it is quite hard to move the machinery to the right way and pace.

pros: Best work culture, you will have a perfect work-life balance. There were very few people in the team, the interaction and also the productivity was good.
cons: Not many new technologies were used. Symbian was the only software supported and not much of an R&D work. More like a regular software development.

job_title: R&D Engineer in Arlington Heights, IL
pros: 401k and bonus are very competitive. work flexible and you can work at home if your manager is okay.
cons: Need work late or over weekend to meet the deadline. There is very little salary increase, even that, Nokia delay for one year. very limited space at office. No cafe, no gym.  There is no job-security with this company.

review_title: Quality of work varies from team to team
pros:
- The company to join after the 40s. 
- Good work and personal life balance.
- Nokia has a got a good brand name! That also matters sometimes ;)
cons:
- Difficult to get hold of good quality work.
- Limited Nokia Bangalore level activities.
- No team lunch, outing or any fun activity sponsored.

pros: Big companies give people chances to goof off while being well paid. Regular range of working hard or not working hard don't show up in salary growth.
cons: It respects people. The leader of the company is not scared of changes and keeps changing.

review_title: Very good company to work at
pros: Human-based management, comfortable work environment and nice persons. Mr. Rajeev said:“Nokia always treasure the culture that cares for people, the culture that make colleagues passionate to come to work, the culture with high efficiency to save time, and the culture to make a better and healthier life for people.” This is true and I can always feel it. To work here make me relax and enjoying my life in everyday!
cons: sadface our email address has been changed after merge ALU in china

job_title: Business Manager, VR Capture, European Region in London, England
pros: Nokia provides all of the benefits that one might expect from an big company including a great in-house online training service for all employees.
cons: Working in a little business unit under the big brand of this global company there are expectations from colleagues in other BUs that "my" BU's products should be available to them and their customers without apparent respect for "my" BU's own objectives or methods of working.

job_title: Senior Software Engineer in Beijing, Beijing
pros:
Nokia is focus on Agile development, and motivation of employee is always the rule. Decision making and solution lock-down is always a result of brainstorming instead of top-down pushing.
There is much opportunity in the company, and innovation and even startup of new business is encouraged.
Respect of culture, there is many sites all over the world, and there is no distinguish among the customs and culture.
cons: The company is not on the fast-development track. And we need more brilliant future as a great company

review_title: Good place to work, but their products are too conservative.
pros: Great people to work with locally. Excellent work and personal life balance. Offices are always inviting and IKEA-like. Local employees are top notch.
cons: Unless you are upper management, you will be flying coach for business. Software coming from the home office lacks urgency and can generally be counted on to be late.

review_title: Was a great school for layer 2
job_title: Senior Software Engineer in Hod HaSharon
pros:
NSN was a good place to learn about all things Layer 2 with an amazing size of things, the QA alone was almost 100 people.
I met some amazing people there and made some amazing friends as well, it will always one of those places I will look back with good review even if I resented the way it ended.
cons: a little less politics would have made it even better. but it's very very small if you compare it to say cisco.

pros: Excelent teamwork, a wide range of coleagues, young and willing to learn and work, old people with lots of experience. Many oportunities in carrer development. Interacting with different people from other countries
cons: Not many downsides, the global crissis made Nokia take some decisions that influenced the development of the working site where i was and it was closed, other than that nothing bad worth mentioning.

review_title: It was rather a hard period during which I learned how 'not to work or not to manage people and business'.
pros:
Big company with a large structure, many processes to follow (some of them inline with the trends).
Lots of materials and information, the intranet is a whole world of its own.
cons:
Changes in strategy, actions and projects are one step back to chaos.
No action taken in several cases of bad or unethical behaviors at the top management.

pros:
Processes for keeping quality at high level.
Job change is possible, due to the large range of products and positions.
cons:
Flexibility is not always the case, due to bureaucracy.
Due to the magnitude of the Company, people often don't see the big picture, regarding what should be done to get the company higher, despite the top-down frequent communication. In order not to feel small, people sometimes try to magnify their work, and this sometimes leads to misunderstandings.

review_title: A nice work place. friendly colleagues and a good name
job_title: Software Engineer in Frankfurt am Main
pros: Competent and friendly colleagues. Mostly not a stressful environment. Good all around company ethics.
cons: Not a startup, huge enterprise with alot of bureaucracy. Small chance of climbing the corporate ladder and little support for innovation. Consultants are coming and let go too frequent. Slow IT support

pros:
Flexible timings
Very friendly people
Some highly talented architects
cons:
No inovation
Old technologies is still majorly in use
Pressure to just finish things, Hence no efforts spent in re designing or re engineering
Product management lacks understanding of customer needs and does not understand both technology & the current product
Too many architects, hence very slow decisions
Keeps changing Ways of Working.
Office infrastructure and cafeteria sucks. Its just too crowded.

pros: Fair and equal opportunities for all. Very ethical work culture. Challenging work atmosphere that helps you in your career
cons: The only downside i see is sometimes Nokia in my view is slow to react to the market, however i see this changing and soon we will be a market leader

pros: multicultural employees, global company, great benefits from day one, lots of employee resources
cons: no career path, stressful timelines, it's impossible to get rid of employees who are not performing well so you end up carrying the extra workload without extra compensation

pros:
- respectful working environment
- good opportunities to learn and progress
- easy going working atmosphere
- transparent work evaluation, regular and fair re-evaluation to targets/goals
cons:
- big and too bureaucratic, slow to change or take opportunities
- doesn't handle well case where managers are in one continent and the workforce on another continent

job_title: Software Engineer in Diliman, Quezon City
pros: Company culture is awesome. Flat hierarchy - top management is easy to approach. Great benefits. Young employee base. Opportunity to travel based on project. HR listens a lot.
cons: Salary is not as high since they base it on the average of the industry. They raise it a little bit though from industry average since they don’t want to upset the market rates. (If they increase too much, competitors might start raising theirs and eventually investing in the Philippines might not be the best option)

review_title: Not a bad place to work in - pretty chill (but not too many prospectss - slow advancement opportunities)
pros: Free coffee and other drinks from the machines, transport reimbursed for up to 100 Romanian Lei per month + other benefits(dental reimbursion), free trainings first 4 months, large company with many people so pretty good from social point of view(also a few parties during the year)
cons: Slightly boring sometimes, slightly hard problems to solve other times and not many people happy to help you(especially when they are busy)

pros:
- very good information & communication management about Covid 19 situation  
- supportive actions like extending home office guidelines, providing tips to go through this special home-office situation 
- personal support service in  place for employees in case they or their families need
- Nokia is connecting people - this is more important than ever 
- more and more 5 G success stories happen
- learning culture is alive
cons:
- hard cost pressure is resulting in cost saving programs and 
- headcount adaptions necessary

review_title: Great employer for experienced technology professionals.
pros:
Leading edge solution portfolio
Aggressive pursuit of market growth and good career opportunities
Global teamwork environment
Competitive compensation (40k matching, vacation/personal days)
Teleworking encouraged
Laid-back office environment
cons:
Roles and organization not always clearly defined so you often need to take on extra informal responsibilities.
Expected growth with recent large contracts will likely bring some pressure to the organization

review_title: A Company with good work-life balance. Recommended for girls and married people who want to settle down. SALARY is issue
pros:
good work life balance.
good place for competency development
good projects and platform for working
very good support from parent companies
cons:
senior management sucks especially H R management . 
Too many old people ready to retire.
Too much of cost cutting some times for senseless topics

review_title: Great place to work, but strategy implementation is lacking
pros: Benefits, global experience, career growth if in the right location, recognized company, industry leader, free phones, compensation, company culture, respect
cons: Very political with redundant work assigned to different teams, work is done very slow, upper management strategy is easily misunderstood

review_title: Used to be a good try to survive for the company, however did not succeed.
pros: A lot of very profesional engineers and low level managers who came from Nokia and Siemens when the company was established make a good chance to learn from them.
cons: Top level management as well as mid-level management are pretty unprofessional and unable to lead the company in a shaky world.

review_title: Truly global and challenging environment albeit a little windy at times
pros: Global environment. Questionable world leader in many areas. Wide set of challenging positions available. Possibilities to work in different countries. Also possibilities for traveling around the globe. Possible to build very strong networks as Nokia has great many partners. Will improve your English if it's not your native language. Freedom to steer your own work (somewhat). Finnish working culture.
cons: Constant struggle against strong competition causes uncertainty. Sometimes overly bureaucratic, process oriented. Too allowing for weak performance

review_title: Great culture, but lots of layoffs and expect to move every 2 years.
job_title: Director, Strategy in San Diego, CA
pros: Generally a good work environment. Smart people and not a lot of politics.
cons: Company moves people around the country/world frequently. Very disruptive to one's life.  Also sales are not doing well so there are frequent re-orgs and layoffs.

pros:
1.Good work culture
2.Good help from Peers in solving technical difficulties
3.Good teams to work with
4.Good transparent communication
cons:
1.The work is quite relaxed and deadlines can be postponed easily.
2.People are not very serious about their work.
3.Its getting to be a service based company with huge recruitment s and its getting to be more process oriented.
4.Freedom to experiment and learn is getting reduced gradually.

job_title: Senior Software Engineer in Beijing, Beijing
pros: Great ethics record. A company that looks after you (but not your wallet). The work atmosphere is great. A great past....
cons: Going nowhere fast. Not a place to grow as an Engineer (unless you climb the manager ladder). Lacking creativity in many areas due to stagnant, slow and out of date management.

review_title: The once great company to work for may not be quite the same.
pros: Previously, there were many opportunities to learn and make an impact.
cons: Currently, Nokia is not doing well and consequently, there are job losses and the loss of opportunities. Relocating with Nokia is dangerous as it is constantly restructuring to survive. Those in leaderships not necessarily equipped to lead.

review_title: Two companies have merged and it is very difficult to overcome the challenges
job_title: Sales Manager in Rio de Janeiro
pros: Very international, open for any nationality to have a career growth, dynamic and full of opportunities. You can really learn a lot in NSN.
cons: Terrible leadership, doubtful execution and struggling with the future. It is lacking behind the other vendors and in the middle of Nokia and Siemens. As it is desperate to be sold or go for IPO, decisions are very difficult to align with a growing company.

review_title: Too slow to compete in the mobile industry
job_title: Senior Research Scientist in Sunnyvale, CA
pros:
The company has a wide pool of talented individuals.  
Good benefits and competitive pay. 
Work-life balance.
cons: Decision making is painfully slow and frustrating. Senior management is out-of-touch with the reality on the ground. Frequent layoffs. In last round of layoffs - several units in US were reduced to half their size - however number of management layers remained the same. Too few engineers, too many managers. Many projects end up with more powerpoint slides than lines of code.

pros: If you are looking for a place to hang out the economy downturn. This is a place you can hide for a while.
cons: Re-org, re-org and re-org. I have 6 managers within 2 years due to re-org. It was turned from bad to worse after I was regroup to a incapable group with full of jokers. Management only likes yes man even blind know what was wrong in the team.

pros:
Work life balance, flexible work hours

Average annual wage increase <3%  (haha)
cons:
No career path for local employees in Asia

Flip flop market strategy. 

Too many expatriates who don't understand local customer

More managers than employees

Losing market share by the day

review_title: Big company and sexy products, but big disorganization and differences between employees.
pros: You can easily get the latest phone before launch, change it as new ones come in. If you are high executive, then perks are good.
cons: If you aren't high executive, you certainly feel the difference in salary an perks. Management and HR is not well organized. It is very different to work in Nokia USA, than Nokia Europe, Nokia LATAM, there is no standarization.

job_title: Radio Access Engineer in Cairo, Cairo Governorate
pros:
Innovative company with good technology product portfolio & performance with good Services & R&D stuff.
Good spirit team work.
cons:
Bad management and compensation. 
Most probably due to narrow minded managers who don't think about something else except their own benefits and they don't recognize that their own benefits is in development of their teams and these teams which will support the managers further.

job_title: Solutions Manager in Belgrade, Central Serbia
pros: I had been working for 5 years for Nokia Siemens Networks. It was a great time in my career.  I had a lot of opportunities for  personal growth. I worked on innovative solutions with a team that had  great competence and  passion for work. This was a company that really cared about people. I loved transparent communication across all management levels.
cons: In order to get a promotion for global positions you had to work either in Munich or Finland.

review_title: Sometimes one big Con and outweigh a lot of Pros
pros: Really nice colleagues. Great office location in Tokyo. Ample competence development available via online on-demand delivery.  Ample opportunities to acquire on-the-job training outside of one's core role.
cons: Annual merit increases do not come close to keeping pace with performance improvement or job scope increases. As such a "promotion" = more work @ a higher performance standard but practically the same pay.

pros:
- Relaxed work environment
- Stable product portfolio
- Excellent benefits (PTO, 6% 100% match for 401(k) and annual bonus)
- Thoughtful leadership (that has navigated a turbulent market amidst multiple mergers, spin offs)
cons:
- One might get stale due to the relaxed work style.
- Not many opportunities to grow
- Very heavy middle management

pros: Dynamic, caring, responsible company. Strong value systems and an open culture of respect. Lot of opportunity to grow within, across technologies, functions and locations.
cons: Rapidly changing technology requires continuous training to stay relevant. Operational requirements leave little time for skill upgradation, impacting prospects. Company needs clear image positioning for value to employees.

review_title: Career evolution and extra work activities
pros: Nokia offers real Career evolution and job rotation opportunities. Allow you to engage yourself in extra operational activities and be an actor of the enterprise to make it evolve and become the place to be
cons: in addition to the operational activities, being engage in extra operational activities for nokia could be very time consuming. need to be careful on this

review_title: Great company, making the right decisions for its future and employees.
pros: Pleasant and engaging atmosphere, challenging environment. The company goes out of its way to make sure its employees are happy. Nokia really does its best to really do the 'right thing'.
cons: The usual downsides of a large multinational company - a lot of 'corporate tools' at your disposal for a thousand different purposes. The company structure can seem opaque at first.

pros:
1. Work and Life Balance
2.  Option to change profile internally once in 2 year.
3.  Colleagues respect and care for each other.
4. Lot of technical activities to explore within organisation.
cons:
1. People are less accountable.
2. Less hike from last few years, not many incentive.
3. No free food or any recreation facilities.
4. Old way of working with many layers of bureaucracy.
5. Change is slow.

review_title: Very political, not an enjoyable place to work.
pros: Most team members and colleagues are good people trying hard to delivery outcomes. Variety of work since you need to cover a lot of gaps. Pays a wage.
cons: Poor executive management. Global 'experts' and APAC management are mostly below average time wasters. Probably the most political company I have ever worked for.  Slow to make and implement changes required to grow the business. Some people working massive hours while some doing hardly anything, again poor management unable to see issues and address.

job_title: Member Of Technical Staff in Murray Hill, NJ
pros: Bell Labs and the R&D organizations of former Alcatel-Lucent, Lucent Technologies and AT&T were great places to work before the recent acquisition by Nokia. The technical assignments were challenging and cutting edge.  The environment encouraged innovation and sharing ideas.
cons: The environment has changed to a narrow technological vision formulated in Finland. Our teams aren't empowered and no meaningful leadership is recognized outside geographic boundaries. Most important R&D activities were relocated or are in the process of migration to Eastern Europe and Asia. The product development, profitability and ultimately customer satisfaction have suffered from recent corporate strategies. If you are looking for a rewarding engineering career in North America, this isn't the right place.

review_title: Great Place to work - Working more than 9 years
job_title: Cloud Support Engineer in Lisbon, Lisbon District
pros:
Work-life balance
Nice working environment in the office
Great culture and values.
Good HR policies 
Innovative and leader in the mobile networks market
cons:
The competitive market is affective sometimes the benefits inside the company.
Many changes happened over the course of the last 10 years due to different Joint venture and acquisitions and sometimes this impacts the normal work flow.

review_title: One of the best companies to start your career
job_title: Graduate Engineering Trainee GET in Bangalore
pros: Great work culture and healthy environment. If you want explore new areas of work within the company all you have to do is ask your manager. They will most probably agree.
cons: During the product release you may have to work over the weekends to meet your commitments. Frequent meetings with customers from different time zone can happen after office hours also. However it depends on your manager whether you get compensation off for yr working over the weekends.

pros:
Promotion is fast if you are willing to showcase yourself.
Relaxed dress code.
Mostly friendly people.
Great health benefits.
cons:
Most managers don't have experience with the software so when something urgent pops up they just panic and put pressure on developers.

There is a disconnect between those who decide and estimate on the high level and actual time and effort needed by developers. If something is missed, the deadline made doesn't change. This causes low morale for the developer because in the end they will be blamed for it.

review_title: No place to be if you want a career beyond this company.
pros: Expectations are not very high, and as long as you're willing to accept below-average compensation you can coast for years. You can attend internal training regularly, and some of it is pretty good. Benefits are average or slightly better.
cons: Reorganizations every few months; can't finish anything before plans are changed. Schedules are missed because of constant changes in requirements. Above a certain level, anybody is permitted to "rethink the whole approach" and does. Thus we're two years late and still slipping.

review_title: A OK place to work, but a dying giant
pros:
Good Work Life Balance
Good Benefits, Vacation, 401K matching
Well known World Wide
Get to work with some cool technology.
cons:
Clueless Management.
Lack of directions.
Re Organization every six months.
Less than competitive pay rate.
Insist of mobile platform that's outdated years ago.

review_title: Nokia Siemens Networks best place to work
pros: Basically the way of company function lies in company Value.Great place to work, immense opportunity to learn, contribute & Grow.Company provide equal opportunity to all employee.Although, some favouritism is also found with in NSN.
cons: Salary difference is more among employee who is working for same year of exp.,on same profile with same Qualification.

review_title: Very partial, group ism, hard work not rewarded at all
pros: laptpop, mobiles, work life balance, brand name.
cons: favoritism, unfair practices even in HR. very quick strategy changes without thinking of the consequences. lack of  foresightedness among the leadership team. leaders have no values and leaders are chosen by unfair means.

review_title: Great, but only if you are in the right place
pros: I worked at Nokia Research Center, the research department of the company, for over 10 years. At best it was a dream place to do research: lots of resources, great colleagues, and freedom to pursuit your own research interests.
cons: Sometimes excessive bureaucracy seemed to be just there to stifle the innovation and keep the regular employees in control. Too much middle-management: sometimes there were more managers squabbling between each other than people doing the actual work.

review_title: Overall a great employer n company

bureaucracy - takes a long time to make deicision.
Group think , lack accountalbility

Focus n prioritization 
Activities is based mainly from HQ, that needs to change! The globe dun just revolve ard finland... U need to leverage on experts in others parts of the world who knows their market better....

review_title: great leadership emerging after a mediocre first 3 years

cons: Heavy management crowd/size in businesses, that some times leads to slow 'turnaround' of decisions OR mixed strategies

review_title: 12 years experience in IT and testing
pros: International company with great colleagues. Good opportunities especially if you have a good and supporting manager.
cons: Layoffs happening very often and people dont have possibility to heal from previous layoff before next one is happening again. That is making people sick at work.

pros: State of the art technology development exposure. Also highly respected in the industry and has a good brand name. There is a very high product culture in the company.
cons: Too frequent organizational changes. Many top managers seem highly selfish and are interested to somehow retain their jobs at any cost. Not able to see profit yet even after 5 years of existence.

review_title: Lots of Potential, and needs to focus
job_title: Senior Manager in Arlington Heights, Optional[IL]
pros:
It's a great global organization with opportunities world wide.
A wide set of large scale products and projects to work on and willing to take on new ways of doing things (like Agile Software Development.)
cons: Disparate goals in which the teams act as if in silos, making it difficult to provide rapid results for customers.

pros: Still a relatively good company to work for which still cares for its staff; is trying its hardest to implement the W8 phone strategy; most of the people left do want to work there.
cons: The windows phone strategy is killing the company, cash is dwindling fast, people are leaving, the commute to Paddington is driving everyone to distraction and insufficient devices are being sold to sustain the company.  Unless something radical happens and soon, the handset division will need to be so.d.

review_title: A great company where to learn and obtain first experience

- Organized corporate processes

cons:
- Deteriorated internal culture (low employee loyalty)
- Difficult to achieve work/life balance

pros: Some very capable hands-on managers and engineers who are very good at what they do. Company has good values and ethics i.e.. no corruption.
cons: Expect a reorg twice a year. Strategic decisions look max 12-18 months out. Planning by crisis. HR is woeful.

review_title: Good technical people, Sr management needs to articulate a long term strategy
pros:
Global reach - you can have assignments around the world 
Compensation is competitive - bonus system (dependent on profitability) can be a nice perk
cons: Lack of direction and accountability has been the culprit of Nokia - it is key for the "New Nokia" (w/o handset business) to fix these issues.

pros: Nokia invests heavily in the development of its employees. There are many excellent training and development programs -- engineering. technical business skills, soft skills. The software group recently adopted agile development, which is a big improvement on the waterfall model used previously.
cons: Although the company prides itself on its "passion for innovation," the strict product lifecycle of getting a new phone to market prohibits current innovations from piggy-backing on a soon-to-be-released phone in order to bring recent innovations or experiments to market.

job_title: R&Amp; D Engineer in Sunnyvale, CA
pros:
There is good talent and interesting people

cons:
Unfortunately there is too much politics and the transition doesn't go smoothly.
There is also a lack of vision, transparancy and communication.

review_title: Motivating and challeging, great place to work!

All departments of R&D present in the same site!
Lot of experienced people
High tech and challenging tasks
Managers count on everyone´s opinion
Possibilities of job rotations, position changes, etc.
Be part of a company with great values
Work-life balance: possibilities of Home Office, part-time work, etc.

job_title: MI's Coordinator, Logistics Support in Dhaka

cons: Without any terms and conditions they sack employee anytime

pros: The company got beaten down, but got up again. Good work/life balance. Decent pay+ bonus for Finland. Not great, but decent.

review_title: Overall a good experience but could be better with welcoming newcomers to the team & the company more open heartedly.

pros: There are a great group of people work here.  We work on really cool stuff that's used by millions of people around the world - how many people get to say that?

review_title: More than ten years was definitely enough
job_title: Software Architect in Helsinki, Southern Finland
pros:
- Regular pay
- In theory lots of different positions for doing lots of different things
cons:
- Muddled middle management makes it hard to achieve objectives
- Too much bean counting makes it hard to create truly great products
- Schedules above quality
- Vision, strategy, and execution plans very often hazy

pros: Transparent and idealistic company with a respectful and international culture.
cons: Has been in unstable financial predicament for last few years with more uncertainty in the future.

pros: People are great. Technology is great, lot's of talent. poorly managed though. This is something management should take a look at. Values are great as they promote work life balance but some culture change of doing something you want should be promoted.
cons: Strategies have failed, lack of vision in the company and a clear slow progression. Now that is the reason why microsoft acquired them.

review_title: Nice work environment and nice people
pros: The office environment is good enough with gym, recreation centre and canteen. All team members are getting along well with each other. The communication between SLT and employees are smoothy.
cons: It's a huge organization with some redundant employees. The product of Nokia is facing fierce vie from Samsung and Apple, innovation and decisive decision from SLT is very important for this enterprise, but I didn't seen it up to now.

review_title: Great place to work, interesting projects, smart people, no clear way to see your work into products
pros: Smart people, interesting projects, good team culture and working environment, good salary and benefits, opportunity to publish and patent. Great work-life balance. Worked for NRC for several years and it was a very good experience.
cons: Results of your work do not always get integrated into products, no clear process on how to achieve this. This can be frustrating and NRC employees do not always see the reasons why.

job_title: Senior Test Engineer in San Diego, CA
pros: Highly technical.  You could do anything you set your mind to.  Pay was great, and bonuses were good when you got them.  I loved the people I was working with, and it was a great culture.  This was the best company I've ever worked at.
cons: Company got too complacent.  Management thought they could do nothing wrong.  Iphone and Android beat Nokia to the punch.

pros: There's a lot of talented people and always willing to make things happen. There's a good portfolio and the brand itself does provide a good support in front of our customers
cons: Too many changes after the new Nokia was formed and even when we internally say that we need to keep our focus in our customers, the reality is that the expectation of the changes coming is distracting.

pros: Global Company; strongly technology.  Good brand recognition. Willing to go after new products and solutions with a spirit of innovation and entrepreneurship.  Full line of products.
cons: Company is going through growing pains with merger of Alcatel-Lucent.  Many locations need to be combined in order to create a unified company.

job_title: Subject Matter Expert in New Delhi

pros:
Open minded, Respect with each other, Have system knowladge about communication equipment, Have a good quality concept.

pros: Leaves , wfh, salary, average hike ( now seems bit reducing ) ok work life balance. Opportunity for c++ and java, good for testers

review_title: Good telecomm technology company to work for

pros: The job is challenging and you can learn a lot from it; the environment here is professional, the colleagues really open minded and willing to help each other.

review_title: What's it like to be a nokian

Although huge steps have been taken lately to address these issues, it's taking the expected time.

pros:
