review_title: NSN is a vibrant ever-changing employer with the best people in the business working for them at one stage or another.
pros: Relaxed and productive work environment, positively intelligent and creative colleagues as well as freedom to create your own workspace within set boundaries and expected outputs.
cons: Rigid management and approval structure that hampers growth and accountability.

review_title: Maintain legacy products and no Innovation
pros: Work From Home, good salary, good for freshers to learn
cons:
Frequent layoffs, recently hyd R&D team is completely lay-offed, 
You will be hired by luck not by your talent (No uniformity in recruitment).
No HR, manager is everything, need to maintain good relations with him otherwise , irrespective of how much you work hikes and promotions are gone
Most of the work is maintenance of existing products. 
Skills will be eroded after working here for some time

review_title: Manufacturing worker at Ft Worth factory
pros: Time off.  Twelve hour shifts with three-four days off in a row.  Clean work environment.  Worked there from 1994-97.
cons: Most employees had limited English language skills.  Management preferred Vietnamese and Laotians over Americans.  Having a degree was a disadvantage.  Nepotism run wild.

review_title: Nokia is still a great place
pros: Great people all across the globe that are excited to work in many different aspects to create iconic products connecting happy customers.  My management team was great, but it differs greatly from group to group.
cons: each site is different, but always a good vibe and energetic colleagues.  Tough to see the amount of change that was inflicted on the company by changing industry trends and the required management action to try and stabilize

review_title: Great company culture which doesn't translate to good managers
pros: fair salaries, decent bonus structure and good job position and relocation mobility for internal candidates.  great engineers and technology advancing products
cons: bad middle management, inefficiency, low moral from constantly failing/changing executive strategy

review_title: Excellent company, great people, great products ...
pros:
- Innovative product development exposure
- highly professional environments
- Great people
- Great work-life balance
- best salaries in the class
cons: - At Nokia Networks you may feel like in the comfort zone and stop worrying about your long term career ! so, wake up and be prepared for your own career, as future is always uncertain

pros: Excellent benefits, health plan etc. Team is great and friendly. Good work-life balance despite the reduced resources. Management is trustful and give you enough empowerment to develop and implement your ideas.
cons: Lots of reorg in the last few years. Severe job cuts bringing much tension and anxiety to the day to day. Very limited career opportunities as the company is shrinking. Business is down, losing market share and struggling to make a difference on the smart devices division.

review_title: I workedat Nokia as system expert for 6 years.
pros: Good work environment, flexible working hours + home office possibility, opportunity to work in global teams.
cons: Salary and professional growing are much more related to who is your boss, rather than your own performance. HR is  absolutely zero, and performance reports are a joke.

pros: Well organized, employees were given with enough time and resources to do things right at the first time. Errors were very rare.
cons: The company did not last, they closed the site and came down globally. I have nothing to complaint about local management, Great place to work and would come back anytime

pros: Very diverse company, great benefits, flexibility depends on which group you work in
cons: Never ending "transformations", Americans seems to have a harder time in this European company and thus get the leftover scraps in terms of work, the smell in the bathrooms.

review_title: Nokia always tried to bulid up good company culture
job_title: Senior Technical Service Engineer in Hangzhou, Zhejiang
pros: work and life balance, respect, challenge, renewal and creative
cons:
To make a good job opportunity for graduates, they will grow healthy and stably around this company culture.
For experienced professionals, they can do what they are good at and develop the skill which is practical for daily work.

pros: Opportunities to learn and grow technical and management skills. Good compensation and benefits. Friendly people to work with and great place to work.
cons: Focus a lot in revenue growth so job offshoring and outsourcing and long working hours is norm in this place.

review_title: Change is the name of the game
pros: Good work-life balance.  Very diverse employee population.
cons: If change is unsettling to you, this is not the place to work.  Change in management, reporting structure, business line, etc.  Nokia is constantly restructuring, reinventing, renewing, rebalancing.....and this can cause uncertainty and loss of productivity.  Maybe this is a by-product of the tech industry, but know going in.

review_title: Low starting salary, low salary increase
pros: We have a shower room
cons:
Low starting salary
Low salary increase - only ~5% for ~3 years even though quite a performer according to manager
Very hard to get OT pay - worked on weekends, holidays, 
Overworked, underpaid

review_title: it depends highly on a team
pros:
* you can learn a lot
* competitive salary and benefits
* easy to change team depending on your interests
* interesting R&D job - not only "bug fixing" projects
cons:
* highly depends on a team
* teams responsible for projects became too large it's very hard to communicate
* high management decisions are sometimes very weird - it depends on low level managers whether they are able to hide them from developers and let them focus on the product

job_title: Senior Marketing Manager in White Plains, NY
pros: Employees are empowered to make decisions.  Opportunity for growth and advancement are ever present.  Great opportunity for international business travel and experience.
cons: Not enough talented people at the table.  Organizations are under staffed.  The business leaders and major decisions are made out of Finland.  The US employee staff have less employee benefits.

job_title: Technical Support Engineer in Ottawa, ON
pros:
Job security in support
Paid time off is pretty good
Benefits are pretty good too
cons: Career advancement within the support structure is rare - only a select few are given an opportunity to be "promoted", while others may be promoted out of necessity.

pros:
Work flexibility
People who are experienced and good at their jobs
cons:
Becoming more and more just a big corporation where the individual is no longer valued
Any celebration in success is far overshadowed by the message from management that people aren't doing a good enough job

review_title: A passion groups of engineers here
pros: There are lots of passion engineers in Nokia. Especially in Hangzhou sit, we have so many kindly leaders and experts, that we can do much more than we said. As basement of our culture, we have much strong expect to each, even though we come from different areas and countries, have different thinking’s mood.
cons: Sometimes, too many countries working together, so you have to try your best to understand from different kinds of cultures.

review_title: A great start for your career
pros:
- Great people to work with in your team
- Good tehnologies used in the company, a lot of opensource software
- I made my setup and configuration in 3-5 working days and all was great
- Nice team management technology - AGILE
cons:
- There are a lot of people in the team, even internationally
- The internal tools are a bit slow 
- Communication is pretty difficult with people from different countries because of the time schedule

review_title: Overall good company to work for
pros:
* Flexible hours
* Work from home possible, based on job type
* Adapts well to changes in industry
* Opportunity to understand global mobile trends and usage
* Green company
cons:
* Working across timezones
* Management support for taking innovative ideas to market is low
* Low accountability for bad work

review_title: 24 years in several positions las 10 years project manager
pros: Multicultural company, who offer change to work abroad and have diversity of experience. Small organisation were open minded and flexible
cons: Huge byrocracy, too much middle level management, too much quarter base plan, no visibility over organizations, incentive system push everyone just thínk own good, even it was bad for Nokia

review_title: Great company for career development in a multinational telecom environment with talented people around the world
pros: Excellent personal career development opportunties, multinational scene, opportunities to get involved with a variety of interesting and challenging projects.
cons: Increased complexity, internal bureaucracies and turmoil during past years. Some values, respect and integrity disappeared.

review_title: Had a great experience at NSN
pros: Good company with lots of opportunity for young engineer who are ready to work. Pay is decent with benefits.
cons: Poor management and constant restructuring. The middle management is too big. To many job title with useless description. The organization needs more discipline and focus.

review_title: It has been an exciting ride for the last few years; to see how this company is turning in the right direction is great
pros: global player, you have the chance to gain experience abroad. Very respectful treatment of individuals
cons: Benefits took a dive lately, constant organization changes keep you on your toes, but are distracting, loss of focus

review_title: The pros and cons you'd expect from a big corporate brand
pros: Excellent pay, good structured career support, training and development.
cons: Can suffer from the slower pace of change / workplace innovation you'd expect of a big corporation. And conflict between competing business units can be disruptive to getting the best job done.

pros: Very good compensation package, great benefits, opportunity to change jobs or location whenever you want, wonderful opportunity for people looking for international career, numerous technical trainings available online or in class, very diverse population from all parts of the globe.
cons: Too many restructurations, can be too much internally focused during transition period, until recently strategy changed too often, employee performance evaluation process can be improved, long hours at the job.

pros: Empowerment for Sr. Manager to manager local team.  Value employee. Great team to work with to built great mobile product.
cons: Management changes quite often, less stable to develop a product that is meaningful to consumers.    Organizational structure across several continent, making it difficult for communication and decision making.

pros: Very laid back and very casual work environment. Very flexible schedule and the ability to work from home if need be.
cons:
Too laid back.
Management didn't have a clue of what was going on at the ground level.
Management had no managerial skills - this was an epidemic and not small pockets within the company.

review_title: Good company, but limited opportunities for USA engineers
job_title: Quality Manager in Arlington Heights, IL
pros:
Winning products in mobile networks.
Advanced large-scale agile implementations.
Great time off (PTO + personal days + family health). And you are expected to use it!
Much of company growth is through acquisitions.
cons:
Limited R&D opportunities in the USA and other first world countries. Outlook different elsewhere like Poland, China, and India.
Need to be flexible with work hours to accommodate predominately European and Asian company.
Telecommunication is a mature market.
Much of company growth is through acquisitions.

pros:
1. great place to learn and grow
2. excellent work life balance
3. employees are very friendly 

I have been working for last 1 year and I feel that the company is a great place for starters.Got selected from College for a RnD Position and I certainly feel that a lot of work is being done in the research in my team.
cons:
1. No celebrations of major festivals
2. less benefits ie. food and transportation are not free

review_title: Not as good as it could be
pros: The ambient at work use to be nice and the advantages for employees, even going down, are good enough.
cons: Hard to develop a career, as teams use to be too shrink to achieve (or even getting close to) excellence. Business management tries to stay on top of technical one, so this one usually hasn't get enough resources.

pros: NOKIA beijing site is an excellent workplace for employee. There is convenient transportation, free parking space for employee, and warm trade union.
cons: There are too many employees in limited workspace and it's crowded in workspace , dining hall and washroom.

pros: Communication was effective with my manager. Communication through company-wide use of tools like Sharepoint, Yammer, Jabber was helpful. Bonuses were generous.
cons: There can be a silo mentality and communication between silos was an obstacle. Recent decision to reduce US staff seemed random and not based on conditions on the ground.

pros:
- it gives you an opportunity to explore different technologies and participate in different projects
- very considerate with regards to your well being
- good name
cons:
- ALU broke it
- as in large corpo you are just a number
- as in large corpo there are leakers and suckers

pros:
It's a excellent company with high respective and efficiency,respect 
is about how we treat each other, and something we work hard to earn from those around us.Achievement is about working together to deliver superior results,challenge is about never being complacent and  always pushing for better performance.renewal is about how we develop ourselves and how we grow our business.
cons: It's too nice to make people leave .

review_title: Used to be a "warm" place to work in
pros:
Has all the perks of multinational companies, and flexible working hours which helps balance life needs.
Dedicated unit and program to ensure business integrity.
cons: Unfortunately in the business division I was in, management level in the region was all about themselves and basically managers without leadership.

pros:
Good customers
Great people to work with
Global reach means you have access to a large & varied pool of people to collaborate with
cons:
Significant restructuring every 3 to 6 months
Obsession with numbers over people & a consistent strategy
Inflexibility of policies limits any real out of the box thinking

review_title: your "being well" there depends on who your manager is
pros: it could be a good place to work
cons:
bad balnce: work/private life
missing interest of managenet, no or too less feedback on performance, from manager in case he/she is located in different location
unclear and/or missing promotions guidelines, no real appreciation of very valuable employees
very often new commers with less experiences employed with higher salaries than those who are working there since years - demotivator

review_title: It is a good place to develop competence in mobile telecom industry.
pros: A lot of trainings are provided. Allowances, compensations and the amount of workload are reasonable and satisfactory. The working environment is comfortable.
cons: The sales and marketing team is not as aggressive as Chinese competitors. The company loses a lot of markets in Asia market.

review_title: Good with respect to work life balance
pros:
1. There is very good work life balance.
2. There are very good employee perks and benefits.
3. Good exposure to product life cycle
cons:
1. Constant reorganizations and uncertain road maps
2. Salary not competitive with market standards
3. Brand name taken hit because of latest announcements

review_title: In terms of job related is challenging, but in some areas seem is unfair.
job_title: Head of Business Operations Managed Service in Jakarta
pros: Compare to other companies in same industry, Nokia Siemens Networks gives good benefit and good compensation to its employees.
cons: I as the local Indonesian, can see that Nokia Siemens Networks is still unfair to treat local. Many expats come, so the carreer opportunity for local is difficult

review_title: Lot of freedom but a manager driven company
pros:
There is a lot of freedom given to the employees, and there is not too much pressure put on them.
Most of the projects are split across the globe. So the interaction with global community is pleasing.
cons: It is a manager-driven company. Most employees are mediocre. Compensation and benefits are very low compared to market. Due to this attrition is high.

job_title: Technical Support Engineer in Birmingham, England
pros: There are many opportunities to further your career at NSN if you are willing to go the extra mile. Thecompany has many technical  experts which is testament to its commitment to training. Good people, good training and endless opportunities.
cons: Too friendly and not aggressive enough for a company in such a competitive market. Also seems to lack direction at times.

pros: Nokia used to be a nice company to work with great culture, flexibility and minimum politics.  By losing so much market share to Apple and Samsung, old team is replaced by new group with different political agenda.
cons: With massive layoffs, the office morale is very bad.  People do not want to work hard but try to find a new job instead.

review_title: Good and openminded working culture.  Great place to work.
pros: Company is full of opportunities, bosses are good and fair to the employees. Lot's of different possibilities to change work positions if wanted. Salary is not in the best category, but not bad either. Normally no need to work overtime. Nokia cares the wellnes about it's employees.
cons: Not much to say, basically there are not many bad things to say. When business goes bad, people gets fired too easily.

review_title: Good People, good products, too much process
pros: People are as dedicated as anywhere, good benefits, working environment, work-life balance, pay is reasonable, opportunity to provide input always encouraged.
cons: The organization spent too much time and effort to create and maintain processes for many aspects of the job.  Little opportunity to step out of comfort zones and take risks in order to excel or improve self or products.  Limited training opportunities.

pros: Leaders at all levels are accessible, Business decisions consider people impact and support options more than a normal company, Autonomy/Freedom and flexibility at work.
cons: Lack of clarity with constantly changing organization structures, roles and responsibilities, Lots of time needed to engage for changes due to a heavy debate mindset for decisions already agreed on, Not enough accountability on decisions.

pros: Great atmosphere.  Friendly coworkers.  Good salaries.  Good in-house cafeteria.  Happy smart coworkers.   Innovation was valued and encouraged.  Was very happy to be part of the company.
cons: Due to changing competitive environment, lay offs were always a topic.   As such, there was an definite sense of uncertainty about the future.  Not knowing if your job was safe became a serious damper on the otherwise great atmosphere.

review_title: Open communication and good sales channel
pros: Nokia has right direction and keeps doing right. Its culture encourage employees to feel comfortable. All staff know current situation via open communication
cons: Organization is too big to change immediately. Sometimes different customers have different requirement, but it's hard to fulfill request due to complicated process

review_title: IP and Packet Core Networking Planning Engineer
pros: Excellent company to work, very people focus always aiming for taking leadership but not at all cost.
cons: There are some little few cons that is easy to mention. The fact that is a global company can be considered a con cause the major company decisions are made in Finland.

review_title: By far the best company I have worked for.
pros: Possibilities to grow. Mostly great people. Really good values and policies.
cons: Because of the size, it became apparent that it was easy for a person to coast along and not contribute and even sometimes work against the flow. And a bit too easy to "scare" management with cost and political bs

pros: Great career opportunities, diversity among the workforce, education opportunities. lots of creativity, good company values
cons: The company was so big, it took a long time to get things to turn around. The company always seemed behind on trends. Management focused on the top performers and top levels in the company. Lots of good and interesting people, but also a lot of egos and arrogance at the top.

pros: Good Work Environment, human-based management. Care employees' feeling, career development. Work-life balance is well proposed by company.
cons: Too many process in some areas, cooperation with different departments are not so smooth. As Nokia merger Siemens, Motorola, Alcatel-Lucent, we have complicated situation at this moment, which confused employees somehow.

review_title: Good tech, very good training programs, lots of fun if you land in the right project.
pros: Training, big name, steady job, punctual hours. Lots of support technology wise. You get what you need to work effectively.
cons: Nokia is still rearranging itself after the merge, so people are still being reassigned and trying to catch up on new products. Some units support 20 year old software written in an in-house programming language (TNSDL) which was cutting edge, in the 80's.

pros: Most work colleagues were friendly and supportive. Flexible working hours and the ability to work remotely or from home from time to the me.
cons: Poor management, especially with people. Little genuine recognition for effort. With staff cutbacks, rmaining staff are lumbered with the extra workload without extra pay.

pros:
Really flexible working time
Mobility - a broad range of mobility tools
Wellbeing heavily promoted (work-life balance)
Sport activities intense promotion through ehealth products 
Employee benefits (transportation, meal tickets, shares)

Employees discounts for Nokia products
Quality focus in every aspect of daily tasks
Great eLearning platform and training oportunities on demand
Great CEO attitude and personality
Decisions are comunicated among employees
cons: Depending on the project, the attitude of some contractors/employees could be improved

review_title: Realize your potential through an extensive career paths available
pros:
- Working environment is conducive both to learning and for being innovative.
- Activities in place to enhance your coding skills (Coding Dojo, Hackathons)
- Wellness activities (Gym, Run for a cause, mountaineering etc2x)
cons:
- Project and Program management needs to be improved, plans should be put in place and planned yearly.
- Due to 1st item, work is either fire fighting mode or many schedule slippages.
- People are sometime resilient to change

review_title: Amazing values and work culture, poor management
job_title: Customer Support Engineer in Lisbon, Lisbon District
pros:
+Excellent working environment
+Cooperation between team members
+Proper training provided to employees
+Great place to start your career
cons:
-Workload not properly managed. You have colleagues with few things to do, while others are fully loaded.
-Not a good place to evolve in your career, lack of incentives from management to have vertical or even lateral evolution/rotation.

pros:
- The Nokia culture is great! This makes me inspired every day
- Team dynamic is excellent - team have the trust and can backup each other
- Agile software development is really comparative advantage of Nokia Chengdu
cons: One minor thing in my mind is: The location is a little bit far away from the downtown.

pros:
- innovation (Nokia Romania Garage, European Researchers' Night, Smart days ...)
- working with most recent technologies for 5G and Cloud
- diversity (gender, age ...)
- high potential for career development (internal job market, many opportunities to learn and increase knowledge ...)
- company is investing a lot in workspace improvements for employees and social responsibility programs 
- many programs and interactions with universities (trainings for students, internships ...)
cons: Bad program management is leading to unnecessary pressure and weekend work.

pros: Flexible hours and diverse corporate culture
cons: Very process and tools driven, need to be more customer's needs-driven

review_title: Good location in Tokyo but very complicated company
pros: Very good salary. Nice location in Tokyo.
cons: Very complicated company because Nokia experienced M&A so many times.   No one including Japan local president does not exactly know the division role.  Even the employee, it really takes long time how Nokia is functioning, who is doing what.   It is true that the compensation is very good but I left before I came to full understanding of the company.

review_title: Great company to work for with a rich heritage and reputation for attracting successful and top rate employees.
pros: Great company with real potential for individual success.  Constant renewal.
cons: Very large, to really grow it appears relocation is necessary.  Sometimes change for change sake can be too much.

pros: Challenging time due to tough competetition. You are almost everyday in a new situation. Nokia Siemens is also the technology leader which makes your work even more interesting.
cons: Egypt expat benefit policies are not align with global standard. Induction of the new expat emloyess should be improved to make smooth transitions.

review_title: the salary matched with the job I did
pros:
friendly environment
a lot of opportunities
a lot of good people in that company, but there are some unqulified ones
cons:
bureaucratic, and slow moving to the market change
the administration expense is too high to run the operation, so how to reduce the operation expense and be competetive in the market is a question

review_title: Nokia is an international company with good career development opportunities for geographically mobile employees
pros:
- exciting and fast moving industry segment
- non-hierarchical organization where people are valued
- good career development opportunities, if you are geographically mobile
cons: Company is at the moment severely challenged by competitors at all price points from Mediatek ecosystem in low end, to Android in mid segments to Apple dominating the +$300. This creates uncertainty for the future that is palpable in employee morale.

review_title: Good retail branch but left USA too soon.
pros:
Nokia was a wonderful large company to work for and they really valued their employees.
Glad to see they hired Stephen Elop as new blood can be helpful.
cons: Lack of a plan for approaching the American market adequately. Focused on low end phones and not enough imagination on high end devices.

pros: innovation, collaboration and hard working engineers. Good use of technology and people are usually quite patient in giving time to the new person on board.
cons: Very big and hence they cannot manage themselves in the most efficient way. Need more specific direction. BU's should be reduced to improve the efficiency.

review_title: Very positve. A great place to work for
pros:
Flexi timings
Work life balance
Immediatel line managers are very cooperative
Compensation is decent if not excellent
cons:
Growth opportunities are limited as the company is not doing that well in the market
Immediate growth is not available. You'll have to wait for several years before you get your number

review_title: Enriching, lot of opportunities to learn/contribute/grow for a person willing to push boundaries
pros: Excellent work environment. Good career opportunities.
cons:
Structure/processes not always helping the org to be responsive to market.
Too many inefficiencies. Decisions often driven by QOQ performance than long term needs due to tough financial state.

pros: Employee friendly company. Good focus on providing basic needs of employees like health benefits etc. The work places are nice and emphasis is given to work life balance.
cons: If you are not in Finland then you have small to nil visibility. The speed of decision making is very slow. The company behaves like European public sector company.

review_title: Was a good place to work until the last 2 years
pros: Nokia Siemens Networks provides an Open dynamic environment with growth opportunities are provided for self seeking individuals. The company is bad at recognizing good individuals and targeting them for promotion. But for self-promoters, NSN is a great place for growth.
cons: Constant re-organizations of company structure, reporting structure disrupt day to day business. Also, inefficient business processes make everything little task painful - such as ordering a phone.

pros: The Business guys (sales & marketing) are really good and deserve credit for the fact that Nokia is still around inspite of the products in the market. with the new windows phone, hope it works!!!
cons: IT at Nokia was an army of incompetent people enjoying the benefits when Nokia was number 1. The new sturcture is equally bad as all the incompetent people are now heading the new sturcture!!!

review_title: Very healthy work culture but poor vision
pros:
Good organizational work culture
Really flat organization with little bureaucracy
Open door 
Well entrenched in Indian Markets
Great brand equity and good focus on post sales service reaching out to depths of rural  hinterlands of India.
cons:
Lack of vision for company
Lack of innovation in recent times
The global management seems lethargic when it comes to listening to consumers. A huge brand equity and weakness of competition has saved this company some of its blushes.

job_title: Quality Manager in Copenhagen, Capital Region
pros:
Very good team spirit.
Employee and teams are highly commited to meet targets and deadline, want to deliver very high quality.
cons: Really poor higher level management understanding of problems in the organization, seems like there is a battle going on in higher level management where individual goal has higher priority than the overall company goal.

review_title: amazing two years and wish it never ended
pros: they treat you very well and they show a big interest to educate you and improve your skills
cons:
actually can't state anything since i was working for about 2 years there
but what i can say is that nokia must improve and change their service type to be able to compete in the market

review_title: fine working environment, few job opportunities
job_title: Software Integration Engineer in Athens, Attica
pros: state of the art technology, very pleasant working environment, flexible working hours, good work/ life balance ratio, young colleagues, working in one of the leading companies in telecom industry, working in an agile environment, working and interact in a multinational environment
cons: few opportunities for personal growth, average wage with no or minimum increase perspective, often restructures, many internal processes, limited job rotation, many differences between the different business units and different countries

review_title: Initially, the experience had been good but now company is dooming.
pros:
It is a multinational company therefore working in non-technical roles can bring better exposure and opportunities.
Salaries are still better compared to Chinese competitor companies.
cons:
Working in technical roles won't help you getting job in other companies because the abilities become very vendor specific.
Company is undergoing severe cost cutting therefore the benefits have been reduced.
Many people have been laid off which has resulted in employee dissatisfaction.
Trainings have been discontinued.

review_title: A good learning experience, especially at the fresher level.
pros: Be ready to get some great experience from the leaders in the mobile space, and key partners in this domain
cons: The culture is not quite open as suggested by the HR. Furthermore, I witnessed that talent is counted in years of experience rather than quality of work. You would need "years" under your belt to get up the ladder

review_title: A big company with the right basics
pros: A large company provides a lot of opportunities and talents to learn from. At least used to be on edge of the development, so could see a lot of new things. Supports people well, and their individual targets. Treats people equally.
cons: The other side of the big company is that it moves slowly sometimes and driving the change can be complex due to unstructured ownership and organization.

review_title: Good Company to Work If you are Manager or LM
pros: Company Policy is good and helpful and keeping your moral high and energetic
cons: Company Policy gets lapsed when it comes to Manager/ LM. They are the only one in company to decide your future. HR seems biased and powerless.

review_title: Good company, more improvement needed in top managemnt
pros: Good knowledge base, good people, good products
cons: You need to know people to stay at your job. Unfortunately, connection is more important than who you are or what you know. Little "mafias" exist here and there, specially with the latest top management.

review_title: Nokia is consumer and quality focused
job_title: Senior Software Engineer in Chicago, IL
pros: Great people, great opportunity to grow as a developer and learn from talented people.  Great opportunity to work on high quality products that will connect millions of people to the internet, some for the first time.  Work-life balance is excellent, opportunity for career growth is encouraged and fostered.
cons: Slow transition to an Agile culture.  In some cases could improve understanding of what users want out of products and services.

pros: Varied tasks and development opportunities to help you learn, grow, and succeed in your career. Great teams and smart people. Managers don't micro-manage their reports. Fabulous, open culture, with lots of communication. Like a big family. Love the products.
cons: Too much regional confusion as a result of global teams; took forever to make decisions without accountability. Needed to give regional teams more autonomy. Highly understaffed due to layoffs. Laid off in the end.

pros: Large international company. Relatively not much pressure. After some years you collect a lot of vacation. Good work / life balance. 401k matching.
cons: Quite boring place, people don't talk to each other. Not much life, no sense of team spirit. Lot of changes, lay-offs. Never know when you'll be the next.

pros:
Nokia has good 401k matching up to 6%.
The medical plan is good as well.
The ambience is relaxed in general.
cons:
The structure is unorganized, although it seems there have been efforts lately to improve this, we are yet to see the results.
Work divided among different timezones makes synchronization complicated.

pros: Very good culture. Not too busy. Seems no high expectation for coops. Mentors are nice and helpful. Can always learning something new everyday.
cons: The restaurant is not so good. Foods are bad and expensive. At least 8 dollars for lunch, even more expensive than outside. Can't feel any benefit on foods.

pros: Good place for starting a career and big enough to have good chances of self-development.
cons: Starting salary is quite low and it isn't always determined by your responsibilities and skills. Senior workers make much more and do not necessary have any advantages in working quality over you. Young and eager workers only get more and more responsibilities, but salary is lagging majorly behind.

pros: Right working environment where respect is embraced/valued leading to culture cohesion. Innovation is the key thing at Nokia Networks with ultimate goal of letting technology be embraced by all humanities across the globe in the most simplified manner/approach.
cons: Too many processes which are bureaucratic tend to slow down the execution phase of nearly every project. Efficiency in cost cutting measures need to be clearly defined to avoid double standards.

job_title: Lab Support Engineer in Hangzhou, Zhejiang
pros: Working environment  is relaxing. Don't have a lot management layers. Don't need to work overtime like other Chinese companies. Company shows care of the employees.
cons: Don't have a lot of challenge. Like other big companies, it's really hard if you want to change something. Income is relatively low.

job_title: Head of Technology Center in Tokyo
pros: Global well known company which is developing again leading edge technologies. Bell lab acquisition boosted the innovation of new technologies.
cons: Big global companies operate according to quarterly financial results. A lot of effort is put into quarterly results. Big investments into 5G and IoT make current financial results challenging to achieve.

pros:
- Great company to work for
- High ethical and moral standards
- Expectations for employees are extremely high
- Excellent compensation
- Great opportunities to grow and develop your career
cons: - Concerned about US-based workers being laid off in large numbers after Nokia's  buyout of Alcatel-Lucent.  Nokia appears to be focused on offshoring US-based work to low cost regions around the world.

pros: I just completed a Nokia training to Mindfulness, to be used to improve our wellbeing and have many positive impacts on our daily job, efficiency and relationship. Ten sessions of 1h30 over 10 weeks. I can already feel great benefits from it.
cons: More employees would like to benefit of such sessions.

pros: Great working conditions, people are very friendly, relaxed conditions. It is very good place to start working at rather than working for long years.
cons: Salaries are really way below market average. It doesn't matter how hard you are working because this is a big company and it is hard to notice you.

pros:
- great benefits: lunch passes, 25 days vacation, health/life insurance, working from home
- paid maternity leave
- your immediate manager is often extremely nice
- your colleagues are nice people
cons:
- too much "corporate politics"
- inspired people become dull after some time working in the dull environment created by upper management
- overal very "corporate" atmosphere
- very intense employee turnover
- a lot of people have no qualification (in c++, programming or telco)

job_title: Sales and Business Development Representative in Lisbon, Lisbon District
pros: i could not find any pros, besides the fact that there might be different countries within Nokia that could be reasonable companies
cons: focus is not to support or understand employees, but to penalize them for everything, even massive management errors; terrible work environment; managers are solely focused on blaming employed, and even HR focus is to make employees life as difficult as possible; support functions only exist to ensure a couple of management friends get some contracts

job_title: ASIC Design Engineer in Harefield, England
pros: A lot of trust is given to employees, with flexible working and a company culture which allowed easy access to knowledge and support from other employees.
cons: There wasn't a clear appraisal programme, and little support for personal development, career development- especially for new graduates.

review_title: Excellent Company to work for with work-life balance as focus
job_title: Hardware Engineer in San Diego, CA
pros: It is a family-oriented job so you can take time off while your professional career can still progress.
cons: Career advancement is limited.  There is quite a bit of people working at Nokia for a long time and wouldn't step down.

pros: Managers were very understanding and reasonable. I never had problem asking for time off and communicating with my immediate managers. Benefits were nice and I had no complaints. Flexible working hours
cons: Career advancement is not very well defined. Lack of communication between upper and lower management. Annoying security setup at the office.

job_title: Software Engineer in San Francisco, CA
pros: Relaxed work environment with flexible timings. Close to BART and Cal train station. Benefits include free data plan. Would recommend it.
cons: The company is slow to reacting to changes. It also doesn't have much presence in US. Need to be more agressive.

review_title: Ok in Devices, Software and Services Unit, but not in Market Unit
pros:
Good Work-Life Balance
Good Brand
Still (but for how long?) Leader in Mobile Devices in terms of Market Share
cons:
Too much talk, too little action
Too political in Market
Slow! Slow! Slow!
Decision making is like debate in a parliament
You get promoted if your boss' in the reign, regardless of how incompetent you are (or maybe that's a Pros?)

pros: flat management, freedom to manage its working time (possibility to work home), fast decision making, good respect of employees, excellent working environment, stress level is acceptable
cons: management has been doing poor business decisions, organisations are complexed and they overlap eachother, Business units work in cylo and no one care about what the other is doing

review_title: A good company to start at
job_title: Security Support Engineer in Ottawa, ON
pros: You can gain alot of good experience at the field I was working in (Network Security) and they provided alot of training and facilities to help you learn
cons:
- Salary is lower than similar positions in other companies or in the field
- Long work hours and a lot of pressure

pros: Not bad salary and compensation plan. Low car leasing cost. Pretty long vacation. Good opportunity for business trip and relocation.
cons: Management is very complicated and generally is not professional. Permanent reorganization is regular for our department. No  team spirit. You work under pressure like in the start-up and stuck on each simple action because a huge company bureaucracy.

pros: great opportunity to work on the cutting edge telecom technology. Has a great work atmosphere. Work on RNC product of the company is fruitfull.
cons: They do not pay very well. Onsite opportunities are not there. There is loads of work to do but very less competent people to do it.

pros: Good product and brand is great. Pay is good. Eveyrone at Nokia has a family like feeling. We had cutting edge technology with wire rate speeds. Willing to move into new markets to stay competitive.
cons: Too much dependency on check point relationship. Moved into new markets too late and competition owns the market. Nokia unwilling to invest the proper amount of money to become relevant.

pros:
- opportunity to travel a lot (if you like it)
- attractive daily allowance while travelling abroad (as well as hotels offer)
cons:
- the salari is rather low. (Sometimes it's not reviewed for years)
- the company hires too many people in order to solve various issues but instead it gives the opposite results but managers keep hiring
- The managers talk too much
- quite offten you just sit without any job and it may last for weeks

review_title: organzation is stormy and forever changing
pros: Some very competent and skilled people. Changing positions is easy and is encouraged. Decent benefits.
cons: Pay is ok but you will never get a decent raise when transferring inside the company, no matter how good you are. Raises are peanuts.

review_title: Going through lot changes. Not the right  place to move in at the moment
pros: One of the company values is "Very Human" and @ Nokia its at the core of everything they do. There is great respect for employees.
cons: Nokia is going through lot of changes in the strategy and is not the right place to move in at the moment. There is considerable uncertainty regarding future of the employment and the company's profitability as such.

review_title: Senior leadership never found its way
pros:
Very good compensation, benefits and bonuses
Free phones and other gifts
You work may have a global reach (depending in which department you work)
cons:
Nokia lost its leadership position in the mobile market
Constant re-orgs
Over-communication and constantly changing corporate strategy
Too much thinking and not enough results
You feel like a small cog in a big machine
Bad corporate intranet - you never find the document you're looking for in there

review_title: My experience in NSN grat value for the company.
pros: The best reason is to work in world known, big company, with quite OK salary for somebody without any qualifications.
cons: Now my salary is much too low comparing too my qualifications and what I am really doing in work.... Anyway I am trying to do my best.

review_title: It was very intense and rewarding.
pros: The opportunities were vast and possibilities were endless. I had the choice of proposing changes that can redefine their manufacturing techniiques.
cons: Proposed changes were not taken very seriously and were dismissed by saying that making radical changes  will require an immense investment which won't be possible.

review_title: The cushy version of labor pool
pros:
Good benefits
Great vacations
Average salaries with good bonuses
cons:
Maximum flexibility expected from technical workforce, stability is a matter of luck
Employee= just a number in a labor pool
Promotion go to the few people who have a stable job around the boss
Lack of structured technical employee's career development

pros: The Berlin office of Nokia has a good personality and is a reasonably ethical atmosphere. They support free thinking and individualism. It also has a very good restaurant and nightlife culture nearby, making it a easy cultural environment for lunch and outside of work.
cons: It was slightly autistic there, in that they seem to be remaking the same software again and again and never getting it right.

review_title: Challenging and changing work environment with personal influence.
job_title: Technical Team Leader in Copenhagen, Capital Region
pros: You will be working in a multi-cultural and multi-site environment. You will have the opportunity to make a career within a whole range of areas. You are not bound to your current assignments, as re-organizations will occur and new possibilities will arise.
cons: Currently the forecast for Nokia's future is unsure. Lack of proper global coordination of various support activities for processes and tools.

pros: R&D has great quality. It is easy to find real experts on all optical networks topics. Also the team is young and has great potential, numerous ideas and has a friendly environment.
cons: Promotions are limited. Management is unaware of people real value, and tend to neglect simple details that can damaged work environment.

review_title: Nokia Siemens Networks - Lack of Vision & Startegy
pros: A global organization with upto date technology projects and good starting salary
cons: Business always declining in the eyes of senior management as they "claim" and consequently cost cutting here and there including tea and coffee in the work place! benefits are vanishing without a clear career path including development opportunities

job_title: Senior Software Engineer in Farnborough, England
pros:
Nokia provided an environment with significant challenges and generally rewarded achievement against them.
A Flexible approach is generally taken - you are free to choose your own way of working, within reason.
cons:
A little too much management oversight on important decisions, a certain lack of trust in an Engineer's opinion, at least in Software.
Salaries (in the UK) were slightly less than average

review_title: Flexible work-time/space but constant changes and reductions don't make your life easy
pros:
- Flexible time and place hours. You can home office or work from anywhere, in moderation
- Great place to learn about telecom technologies and services on the job
cons:
- Too many organization changes and personnel reduction keeps employees uneasy, and overworked in quite a few positions
- Office politics weighs too heavily in getting  new position or promotion
- Budget cutbacks means very few formal trainings

review_title: It was  nice while it lasted
pros: Great work/life balance. Amazing colleagues, sense of familiarity. Tons of perks. Great campus to do sports. Good atmosphere and cool managers in general.
cons: Too many layoffs. Too many decisions taken in Finland that were not relevant to the local site here. Company has been acquired by Microsoft, so now is not the same thing, very few people left.

pros: A lot of flexibility around work hours/ arrangement. I worked with great people with deep functional expertise. Team members are supportive.
cons: Sometimes it is not what you know but who you know particularly in career progression. Exception to policies used sparingly in the organisation.

pros: Market leader, Work-life balance, Ok-ish compensation, Decent HR policies
cons: Nokia wasn't having as many brilliant people as some other market leaders at that time - the few people who are good, are just awesome. Some of the teams had a laid back attitude towards work, not respecting deadlines. Compensation varies between 50th - 70th percentile based on the team.

review_title: I worked for a Year in Chennai Location
pros: You can work from home that is all there is.
cons:
No food facility. For a company working 24x7 services does not even provide basic needs for employees

HR is dummy . I asked HR for employee policies and they never answered, when i went on mail, i was directed to Line manager.

HR policies are for show case. 

Chennai Location is cramped up, were only 6 people are sitting there 9-10 people have to adjust

NSN does not have over time

review_title: General view from the mid management.
pros: Good culture coming from Fin's side. Good benefits. Freedom of choosing projects or side assignments. Investing in people.
cons: Management causes auto-generated problems, unsolicited policies for some of the crucial topics. Too much depending on German branch which has very deep Siemens roots.

review_title: Awesome company ruined by political middle management games
pros: Interesting global level projects with the ability to have an impact on millions. Company's earlier values supported balanced work-life ratio.
cons: Leadership lost the steering wheel and subjected itself to political games, sticking to the comfort zone and arrogance based on the grandeur of earlier years.

pros: Good pay, smart people, challenging product work.  Overall, this was a good place to work and liked the people I worked with.
cons: The work was dispersed to a large number of sites and countries.  Can be difficult to get a handle on everything going on in all these different places.

pros: At the edge of Top technology, always and constant re-inventing itself, quality above everything, thorough screening of future employees, global player, has one of the most famous research departments in the world, 8 nobel prizes !!, inventions such as transistor, first mobile phonecall, Laser, C and Unix, No nonsense people, People achieving personal excellence !
cons: Nokia has no other points to work upon than any other multinational I have worked for.

pros: Excellent work life balance with good growth opportunities. The leadership team is really nice and approachable. There is lot of respect and transparency in the organization. Leaders have set the right examples for team work and the great organization to work for.
cons: Where the leaders are so transparent and clear in their strategies with  so many successful mergers and acquisitions, cannot have any cons.

pros: Interesting work field. Opportunities around the world. Good carrier chances without any qualification as long as you are willing to work around the clock for bad salary.
cons: Company is on a steep way down. Employees are treated only as cost factor. You can make a good carrier if you don't have technical knowledge and don't care about the quality of your product. This company does not have any culture.

review_title: I would return to Nokia if opportunity comes

job_title: Regional Care Manager in Irving, TX
pros: Fantastic European based company focused on skills and culture without the overly overt, necessity of degrees and diversity requirements seen with may other U.S. based companies. Great benefits, bleeding edge product and great people.
cons: None. Just don't confuse HMD with actual Nokia. (Networks)

pros:
Big company with lots of opportunities. Your experience depends on what team you join. There are big differences between the leaderhip/line managers.
If you dont feel good in a team, you can move to another field it is supported internally.
cons: Communication is not always satisfying. There is a quite big employee fluctuation due to weak wage increase.

pros:
It has high ethical and working values, and promotes them aggressively. 
It is in the forefront of innovation. R&D spending of the highest in industry.
It has vision for the future.
cons:
It is too risk-avert, impacting the business.
Looking for growth, but also on high profitability.
It is focusing on the large customers, leaving the long-tail unattended.
Very complex structure, too much of overheads.

job_title: Business Development Manager in Wellington, Wellington
pros: Global company, cutting edge technology, interesting and challenging customers, projects and work environment, flexible working, lovely office environment, amazing and talented people
cons: Very demanding work environment, long hours, understaffed in many areas, many roles outsourced to offshore teams

review_title: Ethical company but need to catch up with the modern competitors on development area
pros:
Ethical company 
People are nice 
Free to speak your mind
cons:
Management are inflexible, outdated, sometimes not willing to improve.
Salary is no more competitive.
Working enironment is quite  outdated, even force employee to use internet explorer while even microsoft doesn't recommand it. Computer for work is with low performance, not willing to pay for the hardware improvment which is much easier for improving productivity.

pros: many development programs available within the company, the program covered all level, from administration until high level management employee, it consist of online development and training class development.
cons: many managers only want to work with anyone that have friendship/relationships with them, a little bit resists with someone new , although the new one have better skills .

pros: Was a wonderful company to work for, but by the time I was let go, there was not job security (as you can guess).
cons: Job security ... not there. Thought we had finished, after the first two years merger with ALu, but it was extended for another two years.  Not good.

pros: Employees will feel the Work life balance
cons: Biased Management .  Old employees have nexus & will not allow lateral entries to grow.

review_title: Old fashioned company trying to transform once more in his long history
pros:
Old fashioned company trying to transform once more in his long history and lead in new promising markets and challenging environment.
Global ICT company, multinational approach, medium-high salaries in sales job roles, technology driven. Large intellectual property portfolio, highly differentiated in terms of products/services. High focus on etichs and environment protection. Equal opportunity employer
cons: Lack of clear strategy and poor management. Complex organization. Heavy cost structure.

review_title: Great place to start as fresher
pros:
1. People are really friendly and helpful
2. Flexible work hours and leaves
3. Awesome team. One of the best team to work with.
4. Supportive management
5. Good quality work [depends on which department and team you are working on.]
cons:
1. Salary and other compensation not at par with other high paying companies.
2. Some times work become repetitive and not challenging
3. Not much additional perks apart from salary.
4. Team engagement activities are self sponsored.

review_title: Excellent people taking on big challenges for clients
pros: It is challenging and exciting work helping clients around the world. You are able to work with some of the smartest people in the world in Bell Labs. You can help guide the course of major companies and their use of networks and related technology.
cons: Telecom and Nokia are going through rough times so they aren't as stable as one would hope. Bell Labs Consulting is challenged as well.

pros: Can't beat the benefits and the opportunity to try different positions.  Good, smart people work there and the lower-level managers can be quite excellent.
cons: Senior management struggles with how to compete in the North American markets.  Somehow North America does not get the support it really needs to be competitive.  Need to be able to turn around software much quicker.

pros:
- Technical training for the engineers is top-level.
- Work environment is excellent.
- Diverse opportunities within the company because of its size.
cons:
- The company is still in transition from the joint venture and some elements are not strong enough yet.
- Career planning for the employees.

review_title: Great place to work albeit frustrating to make or wait for changes to happen
pros:
Clear targets and performance measurements
Flexible work environment
Great breadth of work opportunities
Great work / life balance
Equal opportunity employer
cons:
Not the most competitive paymaster
Slow progression prospects, even with good performance
Difficult to get the right information to make the right decisions

pros: Good working environment, work/life balance, nice benefits
cons: Head office is in Finland, and most work is also done in India. Timezone wise need to work early morning hours it co-ordination needed between sites. lack of carrier progress within US

review_title: Once was a great place to work
pros: Very good work life balance, good perks, flexible work options, leader in mobile technology, good salary if you join with the right package.
cons: Declining work culture, declining perks, declining market share, constant fear of losing your job, no more the leader in mobiles.

review_title: I feel satisfied about working in Nokia.
pros: The salary and benefit are satisfied here. Employees are respected here. Staff club activities are very rich. The shuffle bus is very convenient.
cons: The salary promotion is relatively less as per the promotion rate of similiar companies. The campus is not very beautiful.

review_title: Could be really fun but internal competition and lack of sharing between teams makes it hard.
pros: The company has good social and environmental policies. The bonuses are usually pretty good. The mobile industry in an exciting market to work in.
cons: A lot a bureaucracy and heavy processes. Internal competition is high and cohesion among members of different domains is weak. Direction and organisation changes too often and takes too long to be implemented.

pros:
work life balance is good..if you want to have flexibility...thats the place to work for
If you do not want to do much work... thats the place
cons:
1.. Org structure is very poor 
2..no transparency with leadership team 
3..politics is high
4.. 30% of employees doesnt have anything to do 
5.. Poor HR
6.. No cultural events

review_title: Good balance between professional and personal time
job_title: Technical Support Engineer in Athens, Attica
pros: Relaxed working environment and not too much pressure. Many traveling chances abroad and opportunities to change position inside the company.
cons: Salaries tend to be lower than what other similar companies pay. Also, budget for low cost countries are very low, which affects both salaries and benefits.

pros: international team working, worldwide customer base, job rotation possibilities, good team working, respect , support from immediate manager, taking into account my opinion
cons: too many sites within the organization, too many levels of amangement, difficult descision making even is small issues because of too many people involved and not having a single responsible

review_title: Summer internship - packet core and IN
pros: I got a chance to learn about SGSN and how mobile internet works. People were helping and taught me various stuff.
cons: staff lacks energy. People are not paid enough. Pressure on management for downsizing as economic conditions are not going well enough.

review_title: A company of great people and knowledge sharing but failed to make push through needed change
pros: Great people, true global knowledge sharing, good products and excellent services, opportunities to work with broad range of customers and solutions.
cons:
Management decisions not considering local issues and challenges
Respect fo the employees decreasing as financial pressure increases

pros: Good Infrastructure, defined expectations, good support and overall open door policy. Management is very supportive of new initiatives and ample opportunities t ogrow.
cons: information sharing is slow, slow t oreact to market conditions, decisions taken out of country which sometimes takes ages. Microsoft partnership is not yet turned fruitful and Nokia is taking a hit in the market palce

review_title: A company with incapable management in a declining market.
pros: Great, innovative engineers in some areas. Global scale in terms of customers and colleagues. Inventions and published articles are rewarded.
cons: Management largely unclear and non-motivating. Regional "buddy" groups. Effectively no opportunities for internal career and further training. Financial and organizational numbers/facts non-transparent to employees. Large income differences between employees of same job type even within a country. Organization unable to react quickly to market changes.

review_title: Good place to work for tough guys
pros:
A skilful person who is  able to do the job correctly can be easily spotted and then promoted. That is why this is a good starting point for young and  highly talented people. 
Good working condition and relations between employees.
cons: High labor turnover. Not the best salary in comparison to the other local R&D software companies.

job_title: Senior Software Engineer in Sunnyvale, CA
pros: Work life balance is great. Really care about employees. Great benefits with an impressive 401k match of 8% $-$. The roots of the company are from Finland which has great talented people.
cons: Too many restructures every 6-12 months. You have to get under the right manager to grow in this company.

job_title: Senior Software Engineer in Beijing, Beijing
pros: Good working atmosphere and environment, good colleague relationship, feel comfortable, typical European company, it's really a wonderful company, but all of above Pros are for the Nokia before 2009.
cons: We have a Trojan CEO (former), and a terrible cooperative parter with slow motion, and a group of stupid management staff, and all of these ruin such a perfect company.

review_title: Mixed feelings, plan to quit after 14 years.
pros:
Open mentality, good possibilities, a real phoenix bird.
Innovative, young mentality among engineers.
Overtime is not expected as a normal daily habit.
cons:
Process changes driven by chaos.
Little trust towards junior management.
Changes driven slowly.
Recognition and reward system outdated, static, hard to promote talented people.
The real innovative things takes years to go forward.

pros:
1. People are professional and kind.  If you request, people are willing to support or share their opinion.
2. Proven record for the phone building process.
3. Company Culture
cons: Currently become part of Microsoft device.  It was a decision from former CEO.  He like to do something in this area and he need an army to do that for him.  Now with new CEO, is this still the focus area?

review_title: Worst. Treats you like hell. For third party payroll- never go there! Your life will be ruined
pros: Nothing. Not even a single. 6 day late working hours. They even call you on sundays to work.
cons:
Long list:
No culture
Pathetic colleagues- who dont even know E of english 
No cooperation. They will give you bundles of work and that too of no use. If you are a btech then please dont ruin your career. 
Salary comes late. Sometimes 2 months late. 
If you are on third party payroll- do not join this company.

pros: company coming back. good spirit, want to succeed. naturally, the last years have had its mark but comeback mentality is tangible.
cons: still long way to go. some bureaucracy left but getting better. long processes and decision loops worked on. big challenges ahead with the major acquisitions.

job_title: Project Management in Mountain View, CA
pros: Multi-cultural environment, great vacation and 401K match
cons: Massive outsourcing and restructuring to eliminate jobs in "high-cost" countries. As a result - zero growth opportunities in the USA. Salaries have stagnated for years, promotions put on hold indefinitely - all severely impacting employee moral and working atmosphere. Middle  management is completely disempowered.

pros: large organization - perception of opportunities/growth, better than average benefits package, majority of peers/upper management were approachable & helpful
cons: company was in middle of merger, industry identity reorg, & multiple internal reorgs, downsizing, & employees voluntarily resigning.  US offices were surprisingly very dated, technology challenged, and did not have basic supplies.  Overall energy was depressed & lethargic.  Hopefully new management & reorgs will result in face lift & new environment.

pros: Good benefits with almost European-like vacation policy. Flexible work environment. Some very good people remain there and continue to innovate.
cons: Difficult to get respect at US locations from European headquarters. Currently on cost cutting mission with purchase of Alcatel-Lucent. Since laying off European workers is so difficult, it's easier to cut US workers.

pros: My colleagues were very friendly people. Met one of my closest friends there. Helped get my foot in the door for my next job.
cons: Not the most driven people. Many of the upper level management as well as HR seemed to care more about their egos than what needed to be done.

pros: I have been working in nokia more than a year. Great place to work , where you can put your ideas and that get recognized too. You will be given a full responsibility where you can excel your skill in respective areas .Balance between work life and personal life. Friendly environment. Flexible leave plan.
cons: Management is not up to mark, slow decision making process. Pathetic way to bug fix and code review.

pros: In most positions the work / life balance is good and working hours are normal. Salaries are (including benefits/bonus) at the market average (the lower side).
cons: Projects include really old legacy code (over 20 years old in many cases), often written in proprietary nokia programming languages, with no idea of modern software engineering. Management is in most cases completely non-technical, lacking experience. High attrition, developer's skills are not built up over time.

pros:
balance between work and life
good experience for first job, specially without having experience
flexibility in working hours
not very strict deadlines
cons:
Managers do not have technical background
salary increases are very low, sometimes there are not at all
Managers are not very fair and they promote whoever they want, that means their friends.

pros: Professional employees working together in teams, new working place, flexible hours with possibility to do home office,  extra-curricular activities (social projects)
cons: Open space offices are noisy and they reduce productivity. Loyalty of old employees is not translated into salary increase (this leads to employees migration from one company to another)

pros: Colleagues are smart, competent, and hard-working . Work for me is varied, challenging, and satisfying and I am exposed to many current technologies. The health and vacation benefits are excellent.
cons: This is a very large company and members of different groups seem to work for a different company.  You will have to actively seek out ways to mix with employees from other organizations.  Standard large company bureaucracy is frustrating.

review_title: NTAS is getting worse and worse!
job_title: R&D Software Engineer in Athens, Attica
pros: Relatively good relations among engineers.
cons:
Some managers are getting more and more pushy, they have bad behavior and they get report-aholic.
Salaries are below greek average and raises are just a promise.
No incentives and no evolvement.
Mode of operation changes every 6 months.
Many people are leaving to get better jobs.
Overtimes.

review_title: Used to be great, but now is in somewhat of a downward spiral
pros: Flexible working schedule, great people, sufficiently un-boring work
cons: Everything is about reducing costs, and the attrition rate is now high because of it.. If this keeps up, there will no longer be any employees left.

pros: Helping team and good relationship with in the organisation. People are very friendly and helpful if you are joining as a new joiner.
cons:
Good salary and good work is centralised to specific teams. Some teams have very less salary compared to others. At times repetitive work and management is too lazy to handle the requests from employees.
Too much importance given to showing stats and projecting results which hinder quality work getting done.

review_title: Nokia is a nice place to work
pros: Nokia is a technology leader with very innovative projects, good infrastructure of the laboratories, an excellent place for a professional interested in new technologies for communications. The salaries are aligned with country specific levels and there is a lot of attention for the people.
cons: I wouldn't speak about disadvantages but things that Nokia could improve mainly in the area of the career development where the dynamics are really slow.

pros:
Working on modern products with the latest technologies.
Opportunities for grow - modern education program.
Unique atmosphere that help make creative environment.
People that working for Nokia with their skills and eager to share their knowledge.
Really open for cooperation with the students - Summer Trainee program, working students program, lectures etc.
2 days per employee for volunteering activities sponsored by Nokia.
cons: No specific items worth to mention that causing cons for myself working for Nokia

review_title: Glass ceiling exists for U.S. management team which makes for a frustrating experience
pros: Technologically ahead of other companies with regard to providing tools to accomplish work. World-class benefits and work life balance.
cons: Most decisions are made outside of the U.S. in Helsinki Finland and do not always play well here

pros: Great name to work for, looks great on your resume.  Projects are very hands-on and team oriented.  High client interaction
cons: Limited upward mobility and rare opportunities for career development.  Although management is very helpful, there is nothing that they can do to help you develop in your career path.

pros:
- reputation
- work experience
- fun
- learning
- technology (symbian c++)
- exposure 
- first hands on new and upcoming mobiles

review_title: Excellent working conditions but, low salary

review_title: great environment to work.. both individually and professionally

review_title: Its a great company to work for

pros: It is still a job and the pay check comes on time.
cons: Despite all the promises, NSN has axed employee benefits and cut everything to the bone in order to balance the books. This is good until it kills employee morale and then innovation and implementation begins to suffer. Those of us still here after all the poor treatment and lay-offs are disheartened and looking for a way out. I don't believe it will ever return to the days of respecting the individual and treating human capital as the most valuable company asset.

review_title: Good HR policies which are enforced worldwide

The company values are followed in everyday activities and the HR policies, which aim to provide workers a good balance between personal life and work, are respected worldwide.
Provides the oportunity to operate in a real global environment where everyday you have the chnace to work with people from other country or even relocate.
cons: It is a big company where sometimes things move slowly and are hard to change. Particularly processes and managers.

review_title: No appreciation, no reward for hard work.
pros: The culture, people, work life balance, and benefits are good.
cons: Encouragement of diversity, internal promotion, personal growth, Leadership and communication is sorely lacking. The company seems to be controlled by a Human Resources department which doesn't emit any humanity. Motivation is low and the worry of lay-off is constantly overhead.

review_title: great people and, overall, a good place to work

good work/life balance
