review_title: Interesting technology and domain ruined by poor culture, weak compensation, mediocre employees
job_title: Lead Software Engineer in Chicago, IL
pros: Working at HERE as a software engineer allows you to work with cutting edge technology such as big data, cloud computing, etc. Chicago office is just a block away from the Metra station. The albatross of the handset division is finally gone.
cons:
* The company is moving more toward the "open office" plan which is noisy, distracting, etc. If you are an engineer who needs to be able to concentrate, good luck if you are seated next to somebody yelling into his phone during a conference call. 
* Benefits and compensation have been deteriorating the last few years. Health insurance cost and deductables have gotten worse. Raises barely outpace inflation. 4 year vest for matching 401(k) is ridiculous. 
* Employees are very "clique"-y. Russians hire Russians, Germans hire Germans, Finns hire Finns, former game industry people hire game industry people, etc. and then they only socialize in those groups. 
* The former game industry people are turning the culture into more of a "bro-grammer" culture. The level of unprofessionalism has been steadily rising over the past couple of years.
* Everything is way too political. Too many managers make their teams look good by bad mouthing other teams.
* Unfortunately, information important to do your job isn't communicated but rather socialized. If you don't socialize with the right people, you miss out on important information.
* All of the various support departments (IT, etc.) are terrible. Corporate headquarters decided to centralize everything in Finland and then outsource it which means there is zero accountability on these departments when things go wrong.
* The company doesn't seem to know how to recruit quality engineers. Candidates that come in for interviews are mediocre at best and at worst only got in the door because the headhunter shopping the candidate around fabricated a buzzword laden resume. As a result, hiring managers give up and tend to just hire the first unobjectionable candidate they can find resulting more mediocre employees. 
* The company doesn't seem interested in retaining quality employees. If benefits are going to get worse and you don't have the budget for competitive raises, at least you could throw some options around to senior or high performing employees. I've never worked at a company that didn't give stock options until now. The attitude seems to be that the work should be its own reward. If I have no investment in the future of the company, why should I stay if a better offer comes along. 
* The company prides itself on its "Finnish management style". I still have no idea what that means. The management style in Chicago seems like every other politics driven place I've worked at.

pros: The people that I have worked with were wonderful, especially my immediate supervisors. The work/life balance was great and had more opportunities for learning than any other place so far.
cons: The budget process was painful considering the present monetary state. The powers that be were not at all supportive of the new tablet division. The same thinking that put the company in a box.

job_title: Senior Software Engineer in San Diego, CA
pros: Good work-life balance, results matter most - no any control freaks in management. Good Work/Life Balance and flexible working hours
cons: It is now all about making money and no longer about having a good work-life-balance. They have cut everything just by taking the name of cost cutting.

job_title: Marketing Manager in New York, NY
pros: Solid band. Challenging, fast paced environment. Good people to collaborate with. Competitive Salary. Progressive marketing organization using and testing new tactics. Strong research group collaborating with marketing.
cons: High rate of travel, often unnecessary, but general feeling was you had to "be in the room" or decisions would be made around you. Poor executive management of the US Market.

review_title: Great pay, but you pay the price with lack of growth
pros: Great pay and benefits, wonderful learning experience when traveling overseas to work with ODM/OEM
cons: Glass ceiling for non-Europeans, Lots of meetings and talk with no true innovation, company is full of middle managers who micro-manage and need more training in effective management

pros: The company has a long history of various products and finally decided to become a technology company in broadband technology gear. Pretty good people with diverse backgrounds from Nokia, Siemens and Motorola.
cons: The company lays of its employees too frequently and considers them high cost center. The company keeps sending jobs to low cost centers in Poland and Philippines. As a result the morale of the employees is not that high.

review_title: Getting to be just like any other bigcorp
pros:
* Strong position in telco sector
* Some remnants of the old Nokia culture before the joint venture with Siemens
* Good Work/Life balance despite some hectic times when overtime is required
cons:
* Frequent organizational changes
* Lack of strategic direction evidenced by the recent sale of Here
* Very top-down management
* Yet another merge/acquisition after the joint venture with Siemens

pros: This place was so successful in the 00's and evidence of that persists.  There are abundant resources, lots of high quality workers, and technology abound.
cons: Direction.  No strategic direction from the top that employees can use.  Need focus and priority rather than Director-level managers making their own agenda.

pros: Good money for a first job and City I was working in (Wroclaw, Poland). Also, lot of smart people with great experience in C/C++ development
cons: Rigid rise system, new employees often were offered more pay than people with years of experience. I was new in 2011, and still was earning more than some people with 5, 6 years of experience. This isn't fair.

review_title: RF engineer needs lot of  thinking and finding solutions
pros: I love my work as a Telecommunications & Network Engineer and so keen to know every single part of it .
cons: Nokia is one of the best companies in telecommunications industry. It improves the technology and links all people around the world .

job_title: Senior Software Engineer in Gurgaon, Haryana
pros: Good work culture,Great Flexibility which eventually work-life balance good.
cons: Learning is too slow and much dependent on individual.Not enough benefits.

pros: Love working here. Great team and best managers. Have received support at every step.
cons: Little traditional as in not open to new age work environment. Limited work from home options. Have to fill timesheets.

pros: Good office environment, benefits and work-life balance.
cons: Salary is low compared to others and getting a raise is hard even when your responsibilites keep increasing, you only get verbal praises. This means that people who only do the minimum get almost the same salary which encourages people to slack off.

pros: Very Friendly environment before the merger with Siemens (2007). Professional people management and a place you love to work.
cons: After the merger with Siemens, the company had issues with finding it's correct path towards success. lots of strategic changes made the employees very much demotivated. Lots of people have left the company they loved to work for.

job_title: Senior Software Engineer in Beijing, Beijing
pros: Very good work-life balance. And good work environment. Free  snacks and beverage.
cons:
The compensation is not very high compared to Web company and other startup.
Mostly the engineer have to focus on very small technical area that may only used in Nokia. It makes the engineer cannot adapt to other company.

pros: Best area to work. Brilliant work atmosphere.  Our thoughts can be easily implement. Innovative place to work.  Employee of choice company. Developing Eco partners in very good way. The Kachi loom CSR activity is fantastic initiative to support the village people. Employee engagement activities is awesome. Planting more trees inside the organisation is very good initiatives.
cons: Can plant more trees outside campus

pros: She could provide good opportunity for self-development with good atmosphere. And she could provide more and more e-learning and class-room training for your individual development.
cons: She is still facing the challenge of positive revenue. And she needs to find a way to make the positive revenue in the current weak telecom industry.

pros:
Work Culture

Amazing team of engineers, product managers and insightful manager

Transparency and respect

Amazing Technology to work on (see cons though)
cons:
Top Management can't get their heads right, do no know proper execution and do not seem to be tech savvy; the company starts something amazing, builds a team around it and lays off people every other month!!

Layoffs!!

No driving strategy, even the most promising products have been shut down

pros: we have good teamwork and people are very friendly, professional and patient. we have great opportunity to touch new things.
cons: the company is very large,  the cost of communication  and the interdependence between different departments at work-time  will be increased.

pros: If you love history of CS, this is the place to go. Everything was invented here, from C to Unix, lasers, transistors. They even have a Newton apple tree! Do not forget to check out the anechoic chamber.
cons: It is difficult to find a place to stay during the summer. A car may be a must if you don't live in Summit.

pros: Possibility to change a job within the company, employees expected to maintain proper work-life balance. Decent place to work.
cons: Continuous restructuring and cost cutting. Dropping sales and market share. Company fails to develop new  products and not able to enter new industries. A lot of bureaucracy and other corporate diseases.

pros: each employee could reach work and life balance  in Nokia. Everyone could have a good develop career path and Nokia encourages employee to try multi roles. Innovation is welcome in daily work and each one can have a good sharing to help company. Nokia provides good atmosphere and team members could speak out.
cons: the company shuttle bus working time need match with company working time.

review_title: Struggling under cash crunch, cant retain key people or wont whatever. Trying to stay relevant

cons: Telecom giant who swallowed ALU in 2016 and could not digest properly. Struggling ever since.

job_title: Senior Human Resources Consultant in Düsseldorf
pros: Lots of autonomy and purpose, many opportunities to extend and broaden your experience. Very, very flexible working conditions and a lot of fun at work.

too bureaucratic, too "finland" centric, the new structure essentially leads to multitudes of duplication of work (and hence confusion)
last but not the least, execution of new strategy is pathetic

cons: Poor management. Very poor business decisions are made and equally poor execution on said poor decisions. Re-orgs happen frequently. Not very good transparency into decision making.

pros: Nice benefits package, lots of vacation time. Good location and friendly workforce, the development environment can get a bit stale.
cons: Management does not communicate what is going on and layoffs happen all the time. Employees sometimes have no idea what is going on with the company.

pros:

Nokia pays for education and learning

cons: Nokia needs management to properly evaluate the risks and growth of their businesses. They are losing a large market share in the Mobile devices department.

review_title: Fun, rewarding, it's a great employer.

cons: Slow to innovate, too big and sometimes bureaucratic, a lot of people from old school (especially Finns) who don't seem to realize the world has changed.

pros: it's quite international, and there are many choices to have, such as internal transfer. besides, life in Nokia can be very stable
cons: if you want to get a management level job, it's not so easy because the language is quite difficult to learn

pros: Good salary, ability to work in multinational project (big projects). Possibility to affect product making.  Best possible co-workers, innovative, highly educated people.
cons: Sometimes long working hours, not good salary for all, reduces people at the moment very strongly, very uncertain future, whether or not you are still working there after few months...

job_title: Software Test Engineer in Irving, TX

cons: Working environment is bad. Most R&D engineers do not have their cubicle. they sit in working benches side by side, face-to-face in labs, with equipments running around them, like people working in assemble lines in factories.

review_title: good place to learn & earn (money,fame) great to be a part of NOKIA INDIA
pros: learned to  a provide a better service via better technology,trainers,meetings,
cons: management only give orders to be followed and & they dont try to listen and understand the real situation and dont really care to provide a better solutions.

review_title: Fighting for profit; ignoring human cost
pros:
Good business and technical experience 
Good people
cons: It's like living in your house whilst the entire house is renovated - but with the aim of reducing bedrooms not increasing.

pros:
There is a great work/life balance
Good salary package
Frequent company wide communication

Big machine syndrome. You are another number.
Slow to implement changes
Upper management sometimes do not know whats happening 'on the floor'

pros: Nokia has an Innovation mind frame.  Can develop great assets and has a culture that feeds innovation and success.  Great place to work.
cons: Slow to evolve.  Lack of Management Vision and risk taking.  Stifled a lot of the creativity at lower levels.  Not able to sufficiently capitalize on innovation and bring it to market in a timely manner.  Management grew complacent.

pros: Good pay, Cool work environment, Good work life balance, flexi timing (but not in all projects), friendly colleagues, Cab charges are very less, free mobile phone, laptop(once you complete 3 years).
cons: Very bad managers, they give good hikes/promotions only to their "pets". Poor HR, if you complaint about the managers nothing will happen it just backfire you, in return less hike for you.

pros: Nokia has a great work environment and a bunch of smart people. The company has an incredible global footprint and amazing opportunities for making an impact on millions of people worldwide.
cons: Like many large-scale international companies, the wheels tend to turn slowly. Especially if you're not in the HQ in Finland and along with the time difference, it can be challenging to accomplish things in a timely manner.

pros: Family friendly job. Wide range of worldwide career opportunities. Lot of learning, training and development possibilities. Wide range of compensations and benefits. Location of the office is very good (near the center).
cons: Not the top paying software developer career. In some cases the work experience is not so relevant for other areas.

pros: The company was good with entreprenual mindset in early days. clear technology leader and good employer. current setup is profitable but the three areas left in the company are too seprate
cons: sold mobiles to ms because wrong strategy and really bad leaderhisp. current setup is profitable but the three areas left in the company are too seprate. I do not recommend to join the company

review_title: Very good company to work with
pros: Best work environment, professional colleagues, best work life balance-nowhere found in india not even in any other MNC, great learning opportunity and management who supports employees career growth
cons: Compensation is not good for its internal employees compared to the emplyees hired from outside on the same position.

review_title: Working several years going through several changes, being part of the rise and fall of one of the strongest brands.
pros:
company culture, great products and technologies, good work/life balance
a lot of peolple sharing the c. values and a high passion for the products.
cons: too many changes in short time periods; a lot of people invested a lot of energy and time to keep their jobs instead of pushing business forward.

review_title: Unethical, non-transparent company. Worst place for real Computer Science Engineers in Bangalore. (OSS Dept.)
pros:
- Flexible timing depending on the project. 
- You can be below average and still stay here for years if you have good relationship with managers.
- Paying rather good these days for lateral hires.
cons:
Boy, Where do I start !
- Line manager is everything here. And they really do not care about what you work on or how good is the quality in your work. They just listened to 1 or 2 senior people who have stayed in the same project for years. Some really pathetic manager have stuck in the company for years and completely ruined the atmosphere.
- Full of below average people. It sounds ridiculous but students in high schools can do much better job than most people here. Whoever is here in the company for more than 3 years, they are just incapable of doing anything in the existing projects or getting a job outside. So they have made comfortable networks here.
- 40% of the time is spent in meetings but no proper design discussions. Even if someone suggest some good designs or principle, it is never followed. 
- The senior people in the projects/products are dumb and have little knowledge of technology. They are always against new things as they are afraid that others will find out about their incompetence.
- People who have done nothing but customer support with no engineering or even MBA background can be manager of R&D teams.
- If you are a skilled talented engineer, you'll forget whatever you knew in a year or two doing the donkey job here.
- People are mostly hired from two certain states in South India. They have extended networks in the company and if you are not from those states then you have no career here.
- HR is almost non existent.

pros: Very good working culture, flexible timing, co-operating colleagues. And above all pay master.
cons: As an employee you will not find any problem in your day to day working life. But top managements were annoying. They sold the company like anything.

review_title: Truly amazing working and learning experience in a leading global telecommunications company!
pros: Great company to work for and really professional colleagues! Company was true to it's corporate values including better than average work-life balance, lots of growth opportunities for willing candidates not to mention competitive benefits.
cons: Decision making was not always the fastest and senior leaders could have listened more some key clients to have met/exceeded their expectations better.

pros: Fantastic atmosphere in the office, flexible working hours, great benefit package, understanding management, decent equipment and tools, team events.
cons: Rather limited choice of tools and equipment (although this standardisation is inevitable in large companies), not enough programming and technical trainings.

review_title: Best company I ever worked for!
pros: Professional organization!  You're treated with respect and your views get a fair hearing.  Benefits were top notch.
cons: A new generation of senior execs took over, and the company doesn't exist in it's former form anymore.

job_title: Senior Project Manager in Aiken, SC
pros: Nokia embraces a robust Project Management process that is closely linked to the PMBOK guide. Nokia's training is best in class.
cons: Working for a large company requires you to build and maintain a strong network.  You must be in control of your own career development to advance your short and long employment goals.

pros: Being here, this company, you can get the support,the guidance, and the encouragement from your colleagues, those are making my job here a bit easier.
cons: Hang Zhou is small city, but so many people live in here.I have to cost more than one hour to go company.

pros: Company cares about people,  internal processes  flow swift , different levers of company have convenient means to get involved and work together.
cons: Sometimes  local leaders don't understand and execute global strategy, they consider their territory as a single one and make non consequent desicion

good atmosphere
